title: Let Gangplank be a 10/10 example
body: Of how in a state over the past 2 years where mobility reigns supreme we have a champ whos only escape is a speed boost, be a highly contested in solo que and lcs. Great job on riot behalf of making him a example of another amazing rework in the past year (sion rework 10/10 too) rework done right and shifting power elsewhere in a kit without mobility.

replies.body:
So a speed boost isn't mobility? Are you telling me Udyr has no mobility?

THESE are champions with no mobility: {{champion:22}} {{champion:110}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:63}} etc.

If speed boosts didn't matter, people wouldn't QQ so hard over Ahri's Q movespeed boost.

Too be fair all of those champions have forms of CC. Ashe has Slows/Stuns, Varus has a Snare that can hit an entire team, Zyra is garbage but she still has a snare, slow, and knockup that's however all extremely easy to dodge, and even Brand has a stun.

But then you realize that almost all mobile champions have some form of CC...Ahri has a charm, Yasuo has some broken AoE knockup that can further hold them in place with his ult, Kalista for whatever reason have infinite slows with her Rend and a 2 second AoE knockup because why not.

You can just move out of the way for Yasuo. Correct me if I'm wrong, but doesn't he have to wait a moment to actually throw the tornado. Kalista' slow isn't all that note worthy, and the knock doesn't damage and its getting nerfed so it won't be off cooldown every minute.

His Q CD scales with his attack speed. So the more AS, the less time he has to wait to cast it

If you're referring to the tornado's cast delay, it's like .25 seconds. Not very long at all, but it does give you a very, very small amount of time to realize he's casting it and it gives you a chance to dodge it, especially if you're at a distance. You can also see by the wind around Yasuo when he has a tornado ready, so that keeps you alert

So laning against Yas is pretty easy if you keep an eye on his tornados, but in teamfights where it's just chaos and you can't really see what's going on, he can easily hit an entire team pretty hard with his ult

I thought that when Yasuo gets the Tornado he has to wait half a second after the visual appears before he can throw it (at least that what it felt like when I played a while ago). Team fights do make it hard to pay attention to multiple things but I get use to it with time. Playing as ADC so much as taught me to have extreme awareness in team fights. Everyone is always out to get you and sometimes you have to know when you can even auto do to realizing Zed hasn't used his ult yet cause he's saving it for you.

What you're thinking of is probably just his Q's CD. I believe it usually starts at like 3.50 or 4 seconds, somewhere around that, so after his second Q, he has to wait for it to cooldown before he can cast his tornado
What About YI cc??
brand 1 cc sorta... if you dont like damage or prefer to get melted. jk i still like you brand.
and it takes 2 spells
To be fair, for a basic spell, the duration is op.

>

We are talking about a retarded 3 targeted dashes,on a champion who is ranged,yes,her mobility definitely was and is utter bullshit.

> That still doesn't really explain where the Q speed buff came from though. :/

#lcsbigplays

1) They're not targeted.
2) Range =/= mobility.
3) They have to be used together; it's a barrage system.
4) They're all on her ult. If it's on CD, she had *no* mobility.

She was "slightly above average" *because* she had 3 dashes that could be used in a short time. However, she didn't have persistent mobility; it was all or nothing. That was the balancing factor.
Lets compare her release values (later nerfed) of 60 second CD at rank 3: How many champions can dash 3 or more times in 1 minute?
{{champion:266}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:12}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:268}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:201}} . . .
I think you get the point. Almost every champion with a mobility skill can out-do her in that time period.

**But wait, what if they don't want to use their mobility skill to catch her?**
Well, then how about they just run up to her? She has the second lowest move speed. That means there are 33 (counting mega Gnar and human Elise) champions that won't catch up to her when using *only* base stats.
(10 have move speed buffs, 6 have some form of dash or gap closer, and TF has his ult.)

Nah,unlike you I'm mostly unbiased,so you have a lot of people agreeing with me that ahri's mobility is absolute BS,and I'm talking about prior to the q ms boost,which made her go even more completely retarded than before.
 
> Given her intended play style, it would more likely be closer to the 5-10 second range. Unless they changed it to an ammo system, then we might be looking closer to the 30-40 second range. That's neither here nor there though.

You were talking about 3 dashes per minute,20 sec cd is 3 dashes per minute.

> Ahri using the barrage system gives her a clear window of power. She can dash further, but less often. I can't really argue if you prefer one over the other. So this point is moot.

Except that with her being ranged and incredibly safe on top of it having a short cooldown,those windows are nearly impossible to punish unless she is doing insanely bad.

> Um..... there's 2 ways to interpret this.
> 1)  you're saying I'm defending her because I play her.
>  + Yes, I have her on my roster. She's an infrequent pick though.
> 2) You're saying I'm defending her because she's less "BS" than the champion I play.

> Either way. What champions I play has no baring on the this evaluation.

Fine,answer me this then:how many ahris have you faced in the past 3 months(as in,a couple/a decent amount/a whole fucking lot)?
Cause if you don't play it,I'm gonna take a guess and assume you don't play much against it,because I have met very few people who don't find her mobility to be completely idiotic who actually play against her often.

> A lot of dashes are breakable. If she's breaking any that are supposed to be unstoppable, then that's a bug.

They are,but very few abilities can break them,lux can't,brand can't,cassiopeia can't,but ahri with all of her already ridiculous safety can.

> A lot of other champions also have CC. But again, the topic is her "bullshit mobility".

Mobility isn't bullshit in it's own right,janna is very mobile,the issue is ahri is just untouchable/unpunishable crap over her mobility,that's the problem,same with fizz,same with kalista,same with leblanc.

> For the most part, the only people defending her Q speed buff are the ones who insist she *had* to be compensated for the DFG removal. These are the same that didn't play her release version and screamed bloody murder when she was "reworked into a mage".
> 
> The consensuses from most people seems to be along the lines of: "It helps, but we're not really sure why it's there".

There are a lot of things on her kit which nobody is sure why they are there.

Like her sustain,her true damage,and her charm breaking dashes,and of course now the speedboost on q.
 
> Again. The topic is her mobility/

Yes,and she is insanely mobile,I generally always mention bullshit mobility in threads about mobility,which is mobility combined with kit,but yeah,topic is mobility,ahri is scary mobile.

>Alright,but the point is that her mobility is a lot less restricted than that of other mobile champions.

Ok, we really need to come to a consensus here. I'm saying having 3 dashes on *relatively* high cooldown puts her slightly above par with other mobile champions who can dash once but more often. You're saying it takes her significantly out of line.

So where should we set the bar for mobility? Finding common ground here would probably be more effective than this constant back-and-forth that we have going.

>It's always a factor,you can't just separate things like that,the issue with mobile champions is they're unpunishable/untouchable nonsense,and range is a big factor here,as melee champions will generally use at least one dash to get in range.

It seems like a straw-man(?) to me. You're saying that being ranged makes her more mobile. That would mean range=mobility. By that logic, Varus, Ashe, Koggles, and Xerath are also mobile because they have high range.

Further, mobility isn't simply "the ability to avoid punishment". Mobility is the ability to move around with speed and efficiency.

Range and mobility are 2 separate things.

>The thing is the cooldown on it isn't high at all,especially since she gets cdr as core,you know I'm right,she uses it in a fight,recalls,goes back to lane,then needs to play safe for 20 seconds until it's up,it will be up for every major engagement,it's true that it can be blown if she misplays hard in lane,but other mages would just die instead.

As opposed to other mid-laners who just wait 5-20 seconds (without returning) to get their mobility skill back? She can dash farther, which can make her more forgiving, but she can do it *less often*.
And your comment implies that she will always be ahead. Out-play her, bait her, ask jungler for a soft gank. Playing around her ult is no different than playing around any other mid laner's mobility skill.

>That is in fact a very small cooldown on such a ridiculous ability,I agree.

Sarcasm OP.

>Aside from leblanc/fizz,ahri is the most idiotic of this bunch.

Funny, because I consider all of them (except Ekko) to be *more* mobile than Ahri.
Ekko is hard to gank because he has strong zoning/turn around pressure (largely from that stun). In addition to his ult, he becomes very hard to gank.

>Nah,unlike you I'm mostly unbiased,so you have a lot of people agreeing with me that ahri's mobility is absolute BS,and I'm talking about prior to the q ms boost,which made her go even more completely retarded than before.

Where am I being biased? I'm comparing her high power *relatively* high cooldown ult with comparatively low power low cooldown basic skills and saying she comes out slightly ahead.

As for support:
A) I don't see a notable outpouring of support in this chain for either of us.
B) Even if there was, you still have to remember that the boards contain a *minority* of the player base. Often (though not always), the *vocal minority*. That's why you often see a lot more complaints on the forums and compliments. Happy people have no reason to chime in.

Like I said. The Q buff is just baffling. And it *does* serve to push her further over the edge. Honestly, she was strong without it. They could remove it without too much impact in my *opinion*.

>You were talking about 3 dashes per minute,20 sec cd is 3 dashes per minute.

It is. But the cooldown is also inflated because of her ability to use them back-to-back. If they become a 1-off thing, the cooldown goes down and it becomes more along the lines of a basic skill. Or, *because* it's an ult,  they give it something else (reference: Kassadin's Void limping).
Conversely, an ammo system would give her the choice of how many to use each time. Thus the cooldown would go up to account for the added power. Or she loses something extra to pay for it (reference: Kassadin's void limping).

>Except that with her being ranged and incredibly safe on top of it having a short cooldown,those windows are nearly impossible to punish unless she is doing insanely bad.

A good Ahri will protect her windows of vulnerability. This is true of *any* champion. But there's are huge difference between Ahri who has to play safe while her ult is on CD, and... Say... Kalista who just has to make sure there's nobody behind her. Or Zed who has to manage a 14 second cooldown.
And it's also possible for her opponent to do *well*, which you again seem to imply isn't an option here (Am I misinterpreting something with this sentiment?).

>Fine,answer me this then:how many ahris have you faced in the past 3 months(as in,a couple/a decent amount/a whole fucking lot)?

I *really* need to preface this answer real quick: I'm a support main. I play support in probably about 60-70% of my games. Before the S4 support role changes, I played it closer to 95% of my games. I play jungle the least and play the other 3 positions roughly equally.

That out of the way, I run into her about as often as other tier 2(3?) meta champs. Probably about.... 1/20 games ballpark? So... a decent amount? I'm not bothering to reference pickrates for this response, so I really couldn't tell you if that qualifies as a "couple", "decent amount", or "whole fucking lot".

Recency aside, I've played in games with her, and in lane against her. The most miserable was as Shyvana. Shyvana doesn't have a lot of kill potential 1v1 due to the lack of CC; this plays into Ahri's strengths. But even then, I was capable of holding lane.

>They are,but very few abilities can break them,lux can't,brand can't,cassiopeia can't,but ahri with all of her already ridiculous safety can.

Which dashes is she breaking? Because not all dashes work the same. Most dashes follow a pathing route (such as Leona's Zenith blade and Thresh's lantern) which I could see charm disrupting (same with taunt and fear). Others have a set end point and use a cast time that can't be interrupted (see Rek'Sai's tunneling). And then there are blinks which are something else entirely.

Most forms of hard CC will break the pathing dashes, while being delayed on the cast time dashes. If she's breaking the latter, then it's a bug.

>Mobility isn't bullshit in it's own right,janna is very mobile,the issue is ahri is just untouchable/unpunishable crap over her mobility,that's the problem,same with fizz,same with kalista,same with leblanc.

So you're core argument is that she's "too safe" and not "too mobile"?
Because I was under the impression we were debating the latter.

>Like her sustain,her true damage,and her charm breaking dashes,and of course now the speedboost on q.

Her sustain passive is supposed to be thematic. I remember that being mentioned around the time of her release actually (old forums). It also used to give spell vamp. They changed it when spell vamp got nerfed.

Her Q damage follows the same logic as Ekko's. It does less damage going out, but more when coming back to reward landing the second part which is much easier to dodge.

------------------------------

And I'm just going to repeat the top of this response:

So where should we set the bar for mobility? Finding common ground here would probably be more effective than this constant back-and-forth that we have going.

> [{quoted}](name=Ariel the Cruel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=T08doNq0,comment-id=000100010000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-08-26T14:10:10.042+0000)

> 
> So where should we set the bar for mobility? Finding common ground here would probably be more effective than this constant back-and-forth that we have going.

Alright,cooldown,unless massive(think 150 seconds at max level),is mostly irrelevant,range is also to a large extent not important,it's basically number of dashes per fight,rule of thumb is:
melee: more than 2 medium cd dashes per fight is retarded.
ranged: more than 1 medium cd dash is retarded.

As to medium cd,if the champion doesn't build cdr it's 11 seconds,if he does it's 14.

these are basically rules of thumb,obviously targeted dashes can be seen as less,and a bunch of other nonsense,but that's mostly extremes.

explanation to this,melee generally need one dash to get to their opponent,so that one is subtracted,range doesn't matter(it does matter,but this is a rule of thumb) because a big issue with mobility is that is allows easy avoidance of skillshots,and since fights are generally decided by short rotations the question is how many skillshots can you easily avoid while re-positioning,whereas very short cd dashes are seen as different,as they will be up for the next rotations of spells,cooldowns are 14 as cc abilities generally are on a ~12 sec cooldown,so if it's lower than that you will be able to avoid rotations constantly,this is as far a rules of thumb go.

> It seems like a straw-man(?) to me. You're saying that being ranged makes her more mobile. That would mean range=mobility. By that logic, Varus, Ashe, Koggles, and Xerath are also mobile because they have high range.

No it makes her mobility more bullshit,and yeah,varus/kog/xerath with mobility would be pretty fucking bullshit.
 
> Further, mobility isn't simply "the ability to avoid punishment". Mobility is the ability to move around with speed and efficiency.

That is more easily balanced than the ability to avoid punishment,and is more feasible to trade off power for.

The issue is(and this is apparent right now) is that the game is evolving(devolving?) towards reflexes and instant-cast/reliability,good chase is much more easily balanced than the ability to easy avoid skillshots,as that just ends up with champions who rely on skillshots being nearly impossible to balance

> Range and mobility are 2 separate things.

Nothing in this game is truly separate.
 
> As opposed to other mid-laners who just wait 5-20 seconds (without returning) to get their mobility skill back? She can dash farther, which can make her more forgiving, but she can do it *less often*.
